meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: New Rules for Patients In an effort to get around an impasse in Congress on patients' rights legislation, the Clinton administration plans to issue rules establishing protections for the 130 million Americans who receive insurance through private employers. PAGE A12

Prosperity Has Deep Roots President Clinton's 1993 budget plan is widely seen as crucial to the nation's long run of prosperity. But experts say his administration cannot claim all the credit. PAGE A14

New Rules for Patients In an effort to get around an impasse in Congress on patients' rights legislation, the Clinton administration plans to issue rules establishing protections for the 130 million Americans who receive insurance through private employers. PAGE A12

Prosperity Has Deep Roots President Clinton's 1993 budget plan is widely seen as crucial to the nation's long run of prosperity. But experts say his administration cannot claim all the credit. PAGE A14
Making Deals, Not Enemies House Speaker J. Dennis Hastert and President Clinton can cajole and disagree without animosity; it is a bipartisan relationship that harks back to an earlier era. PAGE A10

A New Jersey Debate, Too In their first debate, New Jersey's Senate candidates, Bob Franks and Jon S. Corzine, attacked each other's voting records, campaign tactics and stands on issues like gun control and health care. PAGE B1
